options.label: a
options.text: that which causes a reaction to take place.

options.label: d
options.text: the result of an applied input.

questions.question: The unit of force is the:
The unit of weight is the:
Weight is the result of:

options.label: a
options.text: the force on mass due to gravity.

options.label: b
options.text: the action of a falling mass.

options.label: c
options.text: how much matter the object contains.

options.label: d
options.text: the rate of mass per unit area.

questions.question: About which point does an aircraft rotate?
If a force is applied to a mass and the mass does not move:

options.label: a
options.text: work is done even though there is no movement of the mass.

options.label: b
options.text: work is done only if the mass moves a long way.

options.label: c
options.text: power is exerted, but no work is done.

questions.question: The unit of work is called the:
The unit of power is called the:

If a force of 20 newtons moves a mass 5 metres:
 
1 - the work done is 100 Nm
 
2 - the work done is 100 joules
 
3 - the work done is 4 joules
 
4 - the work done is 0.25 joules
 
The correct statements are:

If a force of 50 newtons is applied to a 10 kg mass and the mass moves 10 metres 
and a force of 50 newtons is applied to a 100 kg mass which moves 10 metres:

options.label: a
options.text: the work done is the same in both cases.

options.label: b
options.text: less work is done to the 10 kg mass.

options.label: c
options.text: more work is done to the 10 kg mass.

options.label: d
options.text: more work is done to the 100 kg mass.

questions.question: The definition of power is:

options.label: b
options.text: the rate of movement per second.

questions.question: If a force of 500 newtons moves a mass 1000 metres in 2 mins, the power used is:
Kinetic energy is:

options.label: a
options.text: the energy a mass possesses due to its position in space.

options.label: b
options.text: the energy a mass possesses when a force has been applied.

options.label: c
options.text: the energy a mass possesses due to the force of gravity.

options.label: d
options.text: the energy a mass possesses because of its motion.

questions.question: The unit of kinetic energy is the:

When considering kinetic energy:
 
1 - a moving mass can apply a force by being brought to rest.
 
2 - kinetic energy is the energy possessed by a body because of its motion.
 
3 - if a body’s kinetic energy is increased, a force must have been applied.
 
4 - kinetic energy = ½  m V2  joules.
 
The combination of correct statements is:
The property of inertia is said to be:

options.label: a
options.text: the energy possessed by a body because of its motion.

options.label: b
options.text: the opposition which a body offers to a change in motion.

options.label: c
options.text: that every action has an equal and opposite reaction.

options.label: d
options.text: the quantity of motion possessed by a body.

questions.question:
Considering Newton’s first law of motion:
 
1 - a body is said to have energy if it has the ability to do work.
 
2 -  the amount of energy a body possesses is measured by the amount of work it 
can do.
 
3 -  a body will tend to remain at rest, or in uniform motion in a straight line, unless 
acted upon by an external force.
 
4 -  to move a stationary object or to make a moving object change its direction, a 
force must be applied.
 
The combination with the correct statements is:

Considering Newton’s second law of motion:
 
1 - every action has an equal and opposite reaction.
 
2 - if the same force is applied, the larger the mass the slower the acceleration.
 
3 -  if two forces are applied to the same mass, the bigger the force the greater the 
acceleration.
 
4 -  the acceleration of a body from a state of rest, or uniform motion in a straight 
line, is proportional to the applied force and inversely proportional to the mass.
 
The combination of true statements is:
Newton’s third law of motion states:

options.label: a
options.text: the energy possessed by a mass is inversely proportional to its velocity.

options.label: b
options.text: every force has an equal and opposite inertia.

options.label: c
options.text: for every force there is an action.

options.label: d
options.text: every action has an equal and opposite reaction.

questions.question: The definition of velocity is the:

options.label: c
options.text: the quantity of motion possessed by a body.

options.label: d
options.text: the acceleration of a body in direct proportion to its mass.

questions.question:
When considering acceleration:
 
1 - acceleration is the rate of change of velocity.
 
2 - the units of acceleration are metres per second.
 
3 - the units of acceleration are kilogram-metres per second.
 
4 - the units of acceleration are seconds per metre per metre.
 
The combination of correct statements is:
The definition of momentum is:

options.label: a
options.text: the quantity of mass possessed by a body.

options.label: b
options.text: the quantity of inertia possessed by a body.

options.label: c
options.text: the quantity of motion possessed by a body.

options.label: d
options.text: the opposition which a body offers to a change in velocity.

questions.question:
A force of 24 newtons moves a 10 kg mass 60 metres in 1 minute. The power used 
is:
 
1 - 24 watts.
 
2 - 240 watts.
 
3 - force times distance moved in one second.
 
4 - force times the distance the mass is moved in one second.
 
Which of the preceding statements are correct:

When considering momentum:
 
1 - momentum is the quantity of motion possessed by a body.
 
2 -  momentum is the tendency of a body to continue in motion after being placed 
in motion.
 
3 - a mass of 2000 kg moving at 55 m/s has 110 000 kg-m/s of momentum.
 
4 -  a large mass moving at 50 m/s will have less momentum than a small mass 
moving at 50 m/s.
 
The correct combination of statements is:
